intro: Neea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy neea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, often with hairy stems and leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its botanical features include showy, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Neea hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous areas.
